PageTitle: peer discard-ext-community(BGP-VPN instance IPv6 address family view)(IPv6)
FuncDef:
The peer discard-ext-community command configures a BGP device to discard the extended community attributes carried by routes received from a specified peer.
The undo peer discard-ext-community command cancels the configuration. The peer discard-ext-community command configures a BGP device to discard the extended community attributes carried by routes received from a specified peer. The undo peer discard-ext-community command cancels the configuration. By default, the extended community attributes in the routing information of peers are not discarded. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
ParentView: BGP-VPN instance IPv6 address family view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an IPv6 peer address.
The value is a 32-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

ExtraInfo: If a peer only needs to accepts routes but not extended community attributes, you can run this command on the peer to discard the extended community attributes from the received routes.
